title: Premium Islamic documentary-style responsive website for Hazrat Sakhi Habib Sultan Nangiana (emerald & gold archive aesthetic)

requirements.text: Create a fully responsive single-page documentary website (reading-focused) with a modern 2026 Islamic historical digital archive aesthetic using a deep emerald green + royal gold theme, soft glowing Islamic geometric background patterns, premium typography (serif headings, highly readable body), and a calm respectful spiritual atmosphere.

quotes: Create a fully responsive, elegant Islamic documentary-style website... designed like a modern 2026 Islamic historical digital archive. Use a deep emerald green and royal gold color theme with soft glowing Islamic geometric background patterns. Typography should be elegant and premium...

acceptanceCriteria: All sections render correctly on mobile, tablet, and desktop breakpoints with no horizontal scrolling.
Site-wide color palette uses emerald/green backgrounds with royal-gold accents and dividers, with consistent typography hierarchy.
Background includes subtle Islamic geometric pattern treatment that does not reduce text readability.
Meets basic accessibility: semantic headings in order, sufficient contrast, focus-visible for interactive elements, alt text for images.

requirements.text: Implement a sticky navigation bar with section anchors (Hero, Documentary, Timeline, Reflection, Shrine & Legacy, Storytelling, Gallery, Contact) and add a scroll progress indicator that reflects page scroll position.

quotes: Ensure the website includes a sticky navigation bar, scroll progress indicator...

acceptanceCriteria: Navbar remains visible at the top while scrolling and highlights/indicates the active section.
Scroll progress indicator updates smoothly from 0% to 100% as the user scrolls.

requirements.text: Build a cinematic hero section at the top with the title “Hazrat Sakhi Habib Sultan Nangiana”, subtitle “A Spiritual Light of Punjab”, a soft blurred mosque/shrine-style background, and a primary call-to-action button labeled “Read Documentary” that scrolls to the Documentary section.

quotes: The homepage should begin with a cinematic hero section displaying the large title “Hazrat Sakhi Habib Sultan Nangiana” and subtitle “A Spiritual Light of Punjab”... and a call-to-action button saying “Read Documentary.”

acceptanceCriteria: Hero contains the exact title/subtitle text and a visible CTA button with the exact label.
Clicking “Read Documentary” scrolls smoothly to the Documentary section.
Hero background is blurred/softened and remains readable for overlaid text across device sizes.

requirements.text: Create the main Documentary reading section and format the provided documentary content into well-structured paragraphs with drop-cap styling on the first paragraph, elegant spacing, and long-form readability (comfortable line length, line height, and max-width).

quotes: After the hero section, create a well-formatted documentary reading section using the provided content... Format the text in beautiful structured paragraphs with a drop-cap style first letter and elegant spacing for readability.

acceptanceCriteria: Documentary section uses a readable max-width and typographic spacing suitable for long reading.
First paragraph includes a drop-cap style first letter.
Content includes the topics requested: life, role as Qazi, dedication to namaz and taleem, settlement near Kirana Hills in Dharema (Sargodha), and influence on the Nangiana community.

requirements.text: Add a subtle timeline section highlighting: early life, spiritual journey, role as Islamic judge (Qazi), and dedication to adal (justice) and taqwa, using a premium minimal timeline layout consistent with the site theme.

quotes: Create a structured section highlighting his early life, spiritual journey, role as Islamic judge, and dedication to adal and taqwa using a subtle timeline layout.

acceptanceCriteria: Timeline is visually distinct and readable on mobile (stacked) and desktop (aligned), without clutter.
Timeline includes the four requested themes as discrete items.

requirements.text: Create a highlighted Spiritual Reflection box discussing the passing of his children (including Mitha Masoom) and connect it to Islamic teachings of sabr and tawakkul; present it as a visually emphasized, respectful reflection module.

quotes: Include a reflective section about the passing of his children including Mitha Masoom and connect it to Islamic teachings of sabr and tawakkul, displayed in a highlighted spiritual reflection box.

acceptanceCriteria: Reflection box is visually emphasized (e.g., gold accent, soft glow, glass effect) while maintaining readability.
Text explicitly mentions Mitha Masoom, sabr, and tawakkul in a respectful tone.

requirements.text: Add a Shrine & Legacy section describing his burial in Dharema, Sargodha as a spiritual center for the Nangiana family and devotees, and include animated counters that represent generations inspired and ongoing influence.

quotes: Add a shrine and legacy section explaining his burial in Dharema Sargodha... include animated counters representing generations inspired and ongoing influence.

acceptanceCriteria: Section includes the requested shrine/legacy narrative and references Dharema, Sargodha.
At least 2 counters animate when scrolled into view (e.g., count-up animation).
Counters are clearly labeled (English labels) and do not imply verified statistics (use symbolic phrasing like “Generations Inspired” if numbers are illustrative).

requirements.text: Create a premium storytelling section titled “Why We Are Nangiana” explaining the traditional belief that his words carried spiritual authority, the symbolic folklore comparison to a cobra (Naang), and the origin of the clan name Nangiana; design it as an animated, premium storytelling card.

quotes: Create a special storytelling section titled “Why We Are Nangiana”... leading people to symbolically compare him to a cobra (Naang) in folklore, resulting in the clan being called Nangiana. Design this part as a premium storytelling card with subtle animation.

acceptanceCriteria: Section title is exactly “Why We Are Nangiana”.
Story content includes the three requested concepts: spiritual authority of words, Naang folklore comparison, and resulting clan name.
Storytelling card uses subtle animation on scroll/hover and matches the site theme.

requirements.text: Add elegant quote highlight cards with Islamic design elements (gold accents, geometric motifs, subtle glow) to emphasize key lines; ensure the quote content is user-facing English and respectful.

quotes: Include elegant quote highlight cards with Islamic design elements.

acceptanceCriteria: At least 2 quote highlight cards are present and styled consistently with the theme.
Cards are accessible (text selectable, adequate contrast, no essential information conveyed only by animation).

requirements.text: Implement a Gallery section using the 3 uploaded images and provide a smooth lightbox experience (open, next/prev, close, keyboard accessible).

quotes: Add a gallery section prepared for shrine images with a smooth lightbox effect. Along with the pictures I've provided

acceptanceCriteria: Gallery displays thumbnails/previews for all provided images: images (5).jpeg, images (4).jpeg, images (3).jpeg.
Clicking an image opens a lightbox with close control and next/prev navigation.
Lightbox supports keyboard navigation (Esc to close; arrow keys optional) and traps focus appropriately.

requirements.text: Add a simple visitor message contact form with name and message fields; validate inputs on the client and submit to the backend; show success/failure feedback states.

quotes: Include a simple visitor message contact form with name and message fields.

acceptanceCriteria: Form includes Name and Message fields and a Submit button.
Client validation prevents empty submissions and shows inline errors.
On submit, data is stored via backend API and the UI shows a clear success state; failures show an error state without losing user input.

requirements.text: Create backend storage in the single Motoko main actor for visitor messages (name, message, timestamp) and expose methods to submit a message and optionally list messages for future admin use (listing can be unauthenticated or omitted if not needed by UI).

quotes: Include a simple visitor message contact form...

acceptanceCriteria: Backend provides a method callable from the frontend to persist a visitor message with timestamp.
Data persists across page reloads.
Implementation remains within a single Motoko actor (no extra backend services).

requirements.text: Add smooth modern animations: fade-in on scroll for sections, subtle parallax effects for background layers, soft golden section dividers, and glassmorphism content cards; ensure animations respect “prefers-reduced-motion”.

quotes: Include smooth fade-in scroll animations, soft golden section dividers, subtle parallax effects, glassmorphism content cards... smooth modern animations.

acceptanceCriteria: Major sections animate in with a subtle fade/translate when entering viewport.
Parallax is subtle and does not cause jank on mobile.
If the user has prefers-reduced-motion enabled, animations are minimized/disabled.

requirements.text: Implement SEO essentials: set page title, meta description about Hazrat Sakhi Habib Sultan Nangiana, Open Graph basics (title/description/image), semantic headings, and performance-friendly asset loading.

quotes: ...fast loading, SEO optimized... meta description about Hazrat Sakhi Habib Sultan Nangiana...

acceptanceCriteria: Document head includes a descriptive title and meta description referencing Hazrat Sakhi Habib Sultan Nangiana.
Open Graph tags are present (og:title, og:description, og:image).
Headings are semantic (single H1, structured H2/H3).
Images are optimized for web display (reasonable sizes) and use lazy-loading where appropriate.

requirements.text: Add an Islamic-style favicon and integrate it into the site.
acceptanceCriteria: A favicon is present and appears in the browser tab.
Favicon asset is included as a static file and referenced in the HTML head.

requirements.text: (Optional) Add a “Spiritual Mode” toggle that enables soft ambient background audio; the audio must be muted by default and only plays after explicit user interaction; provide clear play/pause state and volume control or a gentle fixed volume.

quotes: Optionally include a “Spiritual Mode” toggle button that enables soft ambient background audio (muted by default).

acceptanceCriteria: Toggle exists labeled “Spiritual Mode”.
Audio does not autoplay; it starts only after the user toggles on.
Audio starts muted by default and the user can unmute (or toggling on prompts unmute) without violating browser autoplay restrictions.
Toggle persists for the session (at least) and reflects current state correctly.

requirements.text: Use the provided uploaded images as site assets (hero/gallery/section imagery) and ensure they are displayed respectfully (no aggressive cropping) with captions or context where appropriate.

quotes: Along with the pictures I've provided

acceptanceCriteria: All three uploaded images are included in the built site as static assets.
Images include appropriate alt text and optional captions in English.
Layouts do not distort images and maintain aspect ratio.

requirements.text: Ensure the final app is cleanly structured and deployable as a public link from the build system, with fast loading and fully mobile-friendly behavior.

quotes: The website must be fully mobile-friendly, fast loading, SEO optimized, and provide a public deployable link.

acceptanceCriteria: App builds successfully without errors.
App is deployable and returns a publicly accessible link from the platform’s deployment flow.
No critical layout shifts or overflow issues on small screens.

constraints: Frontend files under immutable paths must not be modified: frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx, frontend/src/components/ui (compose only).
Backend must remain single-actor Motoko; do not introduce additional backend services or external databases.
Use English for any user-facing text.
nonGoals: Do not implement third-party authentication providers (only Internet Identity is allowed, and not required for this public documentary site).
Do not add real-time features (websockets/chat) or external CMS integrations.
Do not claim historically verified numeric metrics for counters unless provided; keep counters symbolic/illustrative.

required: Islamic geometric repeating background pattern, soft glow, emerald base with subtle gold lines (islamic-pattern-bg.dim_2400x1350.png)
Islamic-style favicon icon with geometric motif, emerald and gold, minimal and crisp (favicon-islamic.dim_512x512.png)
